cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW today, then slowing and bending NW–N toward the southeast Louisiana/Mississippi coast, then crawling N-NE along the northern Gulf Coast through Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi Gulf Coast (near the MS/AL border)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama Border to the Alabama/Florida Border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Mississippi/Alabama Border to Indian Pass FL; Storm Surge Warning: Port Fourchon LA to AL/FL Border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through the Mississippi and Alabama coasts into the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely with a 77% chance; up to 32% chance of sustained 50-kt winds and a 9% chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Warning in effect; inundation of 4–6 ft above ground level possible in Mobile Bay and the adjacent Alabama coast as early as late Monday night/Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain (locally higher) expected, producing life-threatening flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged river flooding after passage.
